result.execSummary:
The defendant Katherine P. Petermann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

DNA sample required.
Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
Undergo an AODA assessment and participate in treatment as recommended, at agent's discretion.

timeConds.notes:
11-13-2018 - Defendant can do her jail time on electronic monitoring  according to the Department of Corrections and jail specifications.  

Probation agent to determine start time.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, and at no additional cost to Taylor County

Days Credit Worksheet

Defendant Katherine P. Petermann in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement placed on the record by Atty. Tlusty. DE entered a plea of guilty to Ct. 1.  Plea colloquy. Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC. Brief comments by counsel and defendant. Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for four years with the following conditions; no fine but court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; reimbursement of the $100.00 buy money; AODA and follow treatment recommendations at agent's discretion; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; 15 days county jail with huber. ap

Defendant Katherine P. Petermann in court with attorney Justin D Wolff.  Kristi S Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed by the defendant.  Court found waiver given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.  Based on the waiver the court bound DE over for trial.  Information mirroring the complaint filed by the state, with further reading of same waived.  Plea of not guilty entered to the charge(s).  Matter to continue to track along with the misdemeanor case.  Motions shall be schedule.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Katherine P. Petermann in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waived further reading of complaint; preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived.  PTC set.  State requested a $3000 signature bond with booking and no consumption or possession of controlled substances without valid prescription.  No objection - so ordered.
